formattedAddress: 39 1/2 Crosby St, New York, NY 10012, USA
adrFormatAddress: 39 1/2 Crosby St, New York, NY 10012, USA

originalText.text: A super fun place. Cocktails are creative and the atmosphere is clean and beautiful. Had a great time and fun place for friends and date night! Definitely recommend. We had dessert and while cake was a bit dry will be back for a full dinner.

text.text: A super fun place. Cocktails are creative and the atmosphere is clean and beautiful. Had a great time and fun place for friends and date night! Definitely recommend. We had dessert and while cake was a bit dry will be back for a full dinner.

originalText.text: Lovvvve this place. Great food and cocktails. I just had a snack / the prosciutto /fig /Brie bread and a mimosa. My friend had a delicious Niçoise salad. Service was perfect. Atmosphere too!  Love the adjacent gift shop where you can browse before or after you eat!

text.text: Lovvvve this place. Great food and cocktails. I just had a snack / the prosciutto /fig /Brie bread and a mimosa. My friend had a delicious Niçoise salad. Service was perfect. Atmosphere too!  Love the adjacent gift shop where you can browse before or after you eat!

originalText.text:
I took myself on a solo date and had a very positive experience. The staff are kind and attentive and the space is beautiful.
They have a great selection of food and champagne/cocktails. I ate the ham and cheese croissant which was delicious and filling. I highly recommend this place!

text.text:
I took myself on a solo date and had a very positive experience. The staff are kind and attentive and the space is beautiful.
They have a great selection of food and champagne/cocktails. I ate the ham and cheese croissant which was delicious and filling. I highly recommend this place!

originalText.text:
I discovered this place through TikTok and had to check it out. Let me tell you, and it was the best choice I made!

The drinks were delicious. I love how they use various sparkling wines as part of their drinks. I had several types; the Lavender Haze and the elderflower spritz were my favorites, but they all were delicious.

The food is exceptional and pairs so well with their drinks options. I had the chips appetizer, the charcuterie board, and an egg sandwich (not pictured because I devoured it).

I was in NY for less than four days and came here twice! It is such a great place to check out for any occasion, from a spot to read a book if you’re walking the city solo or for a date with a friend or to having date night.

I highly recommend visiting Champers. It is a cute and quaint spot that not only has great drinks and food options, but plays a great variety of rock music too!

originalText.text: Champers is an amazing experience in the Soho area of New York City. The ambience and decor are wonderful. My husband and I had amazing service there Thanksgiving weekend. The dining room was very busy, but we were able to find spots at the bar to enjoy incredible service. We later found out the owner was waiting on us. The co-owner brought us a beautiful fig toast with goat cheese, that we’ve been trying to re-create unsuccessfully ever since. Lol.  We indulged in caviar, which was presented beautifully and quickly the Champagne service was phenomenal. The owners knowledge and recommendations were unparalleled. It’s such a fun place to enjoy a snack or a full meal. The attached gift shop was lovely. The entire experience was wonderful. They were even able to give us some recommendations for other places to dine in the neighborhood that did not disappoint, we will definitely be returning to Champers the vibe the decor the music the energy were all so good! You can tell the owners really care and are very invested in their business. This should be a favorite spot for all! It’s definitely our kind of place.
